meanings.sent1: I will reblend the colors to make a new shade.
meanings.sent2: After adding more ingredients, you can reblend the smoothie for a better taste.
meanings.sent3: Trying to reblend the spilled paint on the canvas just made a mess!
meanings.sent4: Her memories of the trip reblend in her mind like a vivid painting.
meanings.sent5: The artist's goal is to reblend traditional techniques with modern styles.

meanings.sent1: To fix the mistake, you need to reblend the ingredients.
meanings.sent2: After the sauce settled, she had to reblend it before serving.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally dropped the cake, so he had to reblend it from scratch.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship reblends effortlessly every time they meet.
meanings.sent5: The music producer decided to reblend the tracks for a smoother transition.
